intro: Cryptantha parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it has a fibrous root system. Cryptantha parviflora is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in disturbed soils.
